content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

You can use the following code to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`).

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    question = ""
    answer = ""

    for line in split(md, '\n')
        if occursin("# Question", line) && !occursin("##", line) # Skip nested questions
            line = replace(strip(line), "\n" => "")
            question = split(line, ':', keepempty=false)[end]
        elseif occursin("# Answer", line) && !occursin("##", line) # Skip nested answers
            line = replace(strip(line), "\n" => "")
            answer = split(line, ':', keepempty=false)[end]
        elseif occursin("#", line) && !occursin("##", line) # Skip all other headings
            continue
        else
            question *= "\n$(strip(line))"
            answer *= "\n$(strip(line))"
        end
    end

    return (question, answer)
end
```

This function will return a tuple with the question and answer extracted from the `md` text. It first initializes two empty strings for storing the question and answer respectively. Then it iterates through each line in the markdown text. If a line starts with "# Question" or "# Answer" (ignoring nested headings), it extracts that particular section and stores it in the respective variable. If a line doesn't start with either of these headings, it appends the cleaned line to both the question and answer strings. The final result is then returned as a tuple containing the question and answer text.

Note: This solution assumes that the markdown text contains only one question and one answer. If you have multiple questions and answers in your markdown, please modify the code accordingly.
